entry.title: Sharing block templates
entry.summary: The recent discussions have brought to light the concept of set reconciliation within the realm of sharing templates for implementing transaction features. This approach is considered straightforward for understanding and applying the said feature. However, there's an emerging curiosity about its applicability and efficiency when it comes to sharing a volume of transactions that exceeds what a single block or template can hold. The conversation hints at exploring beyond the conventional methods, suggesting that there might be innovative pathways to facilitate the sharing of transactions in a more scalable manner. This opens up a dialogue on evaluating the potential of set reconciliation techniques not previously considered in depth, indicating a shift towards looking for more robust solutions in handling larger datasets or transaction volumes efficiently.
